shortSummary: Explore Akureyri, Iceland's northern capital, before embarking on a scenic drive of the Troll Peninsula featuring mountain horseback riding and unique beer spa relaxation.
Wind through Iceland's East Fjords with their dramatic coastal roads, picturesque fishing villages, and hidden waterfalls, experiencing a more authentic side of Iceland away from the crowds.
summary: After several days of intense hiking and sightseeing, enjoy a more relaxed pace exploring Akureyri, Iceland's northern capital, and the stunning Tr√∂llaskagi (Troll Peninsula). This region offers dramatic mountain scenery, charming fishing villages, and unique cultural experiences. From colorful gardens to coastal fjord views, mountain horseback riding, and Icelandic beer spa relaxation, today provides a perfect blend of cultural immersion and natural beauty off the typical tourist path.

schedule.title: Akureyri Botanical Gardens
schedule.description: Visit one of the northernmost botanical gardens in the world, showcasing Arctic flora and plants from around the world. The gardens are particularly beautiful in July when many species are in full bloom.
details: Features over 7,000 plant species including all native Icelandic plants
Founded in 1912, making it one of Iceland's oldest gardens
Located just 65 degrees south of the Arctic Circle
Beautiful setting with mountain and fjord views
Free entry, open from 8AM

alternatives.title: Grafarkirkja
alternatives.description: Iceland's oldest church (17th century) with hand-carved wooden beams and a traditional turf roof. This tiny church was dismantled in 1950 and reconstructed in the 1960s as a historical monument.

alternatives.title: Forest Lagoon
alternatives.description: New geothermal spa near Akureyri featuring infinity pools carved into the mountainside with forest and fjord views. More upscale and less crowded alternative to the more famous lagoons.
